Check your resume for spelling and gramm: Check your resume for spelling and grammar errors, and have someone else review it as well.
homelist1: Use keywords: Many companies use software to scan resumes for keywords. Make sure to include relevant keywords from the job description.
homelist2: Don't exaggerate your qualifications or experience, and be prepared to back up any claims you make on your resume.
Make it easy to contact you: Make it easy to contact you
homelist3: Include your name, phone number, email address, and LinkedIn profile (if you have one) at the top of your resume.
homelist4: Your resume should be easy to read and should not exceed two pages. Use bullet points and clear headings to break up the text
homelist5: Choose a clean and modern font, and stick to a professional format. Use a template if you're unsure where to start.
Customize your resume for each job: Customize your resume for each job
homelist6: Tailor your resume to the job you're applying for by highlighting the  skills and experience that match the job description.

Make sure your form has no spelling or a: Make sure your form has no spelling or any type of mistakes.
Include your full legal name at the top: Include your full legal name at the top of the document in a larger font size than the rest of the content.
perinfolist: Provide essential contact details such as your phone number, email address, and location (city and state or country). Avoid sharing unnecessary personal information like your marital status or social security number.
perinfolist2: Use a simple and professional email address that incorporates your name, such as firstname.lastname@email.com
perinfolist3: Unless specifically requested, it's generally not necessary to include your full mailing address. Providing your city and state is usually sufficient.Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur, adipisicing Architecto, dolor.
perinfolist4: If you have a personal website or online portfolio showcasing your work, skills, or achievements, include a link to it.
edusklist1: Start with your most recent or highest level of education and work backward chronologically.
edusklist2: Include the name of the institution, degree or qualification earned, field of study, and the dates of attendance or graduation.
edusklist3: Highlight any honors, awards, or notable achievements during your academic journey.
edusklist4: Tailor your skills section to include those directly related to the job you're applying for. This could include technical skills, software proficiency, languages spoken, or specific industry knowledge.
edusklist5: Organize your skills into categories (e.g., technical skills, interpersonal skills) to provide clarity and ease of reading.
edusklist6: Place the most critical and relevant skills at the beginning of each category to grab the reader's attention.
edusklist7: Incorporate keywords from the job description to align your skills with the employer's requirements and increase the likelihood of your resume being selected by applicant tracking systems (ATS).
